<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/26/white-house-ups-pressure-mbs-new-report?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The White House Implicates MBS, but...That's It
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/26/white-house-ups-pressure-mbs-new-report" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="TOPSHOT - Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman attends the Future Inve..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjAyL3RvcHNob3Qtc2F1ZGktcG9saXRpY3MtZGkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Fayez Nureldine/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US has concluded that Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/26/us-intelligence-concludes-saudi-crown-prince-mohammed-bin-salman-approved-killing-of-journalist-jamal-khashoggi-.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approved</a> an operation to “capture or kill” journalist Jamal Khashoggi, according to an intelligence report released yesterday. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The backstory</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Khashoggi, a Washington Post columnist and critic of the Saudi royal family, was assassinated in 2018 in the Saudi consulate in Istanbul. Khashoggi’s killing drew outrage from the international media and US lawmakers, and investigations zeroed in on the role of Mohammed bin Salman (MBS), the 35-year-old de facto ruler of the kingdom. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the report released yesterday, we learned the CIA’s reasoning for implicating MBS: He’s so powerful and controls so much of the Saudi intelligence apparatus that there’s simply no way this operation would’ve happened without him giving the thumbs up. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why it matters for the business world</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the world’s largest oil exporter, Saudi Arabia has always been influential in the global energy market. But its recent push to diversify away from fossil fuels means it’s become a muscular player in defense, high tech, and even entertainment.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The kingdom’s sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund of Saudi Arabia (PIF), has </span><span><a href="https://www.cbinsights.com/research/saudi-arabia-pif-tech-investments/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invested</a></span><span> in more tech companies than the average college sophomore on Robinhood. It acquired a large stake in Uber, and it’s also funded Tesla, Virgin Galactic, and Lucid Motors. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Saudi Arabia is also the largest buyer of US defense goods.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Following Khashoggi’s murder in 2018, corporate America tried to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2018-10-16/skipping-davos-in-the-desert-in-khashoggi-s-name-isn-t-enough?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">distance itself</a> from the kingdom by skipping the buzzy “Davos in the Desert” investment conference held in the Saudi capital, Riyadh. But many returned the next year as pressure died down, partially because President Trump tried to squash any tensions that would interfere with the US-Saudi relationship. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>while Biden is aiming to “recalibrate” the US’ stance toward Saudi Arabia, he’s still tiptoeing around. According to the NYT, the president <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/26/us/politics/biden-mbs-khashoggi.html?action=click&module=Spotlight&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">isn’t planning</a> on directly penalizing MBS for his role in Khashoggi’s murder because the price of alienating a geopolitical ally is “too high.”  </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/26/covid-vaccine-tracker?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Covid Vaccine Tracker
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/26/covid-vaccine-tracker" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Vaccine tracker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjA0L3ZhY2NpbmVfdHJhY2tlci5KUEciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s our newest Saturday tradition (hopefully it won’t last forever).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In the US...</strong></span><span>70.5 million doses, or 21.2 doses for every 100 people, have been administered, </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to Bloomberg</a></span><span>. That’s up from 59.1 million doses last Saturday.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Around the world…</strong></span><span>231 million doses have been administered in 100 different countries, up from 193 million doses in 87 countries last week.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The latest updates</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On the launching pad: </strong>Johnson & Johnson’s single-dose vaccine candidate is on the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/johnson-and-johnson-covid-19-vaccine-fda-expert-panel-recommendation-11614294002?page=1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">verge of approval</a> after a panel of health experts recommended it for authorization yesterday. The FDA is expected to greenlight what would be the US’ third approved vaccine sometime later today. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Should’ve stayed home: </strong>The head of Canada’s largest pension fund <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/canada-pension-fund-head-resigns-after-report-of-covid-19-vaccination-in-middle-east-11614347392?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">resigned yesterday</a> over a trip he took to get a vaccine shot in the UAE. The trip wasn’t illegal, but it <em>was</em> a bad look given Canada’s slooooow vaccine rollout—as of Thursday, only 4.5% of its population had received at least one dose. Speaking of...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cleared for takeoff:</strong> Regulators in Canada <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/international/americas/540701-canada-approves-astrazeneca-covid-19-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approved AstraZeneca’s vaccine</a> for adults, the third vaccine it’s approved.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/26/netflix-starts-100-million-global-diversity-fund?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Netflix Wants to Make More of Its Content Look Like <em>Bridgerton</em>
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/26/netflix-starts-100-million-global-diversity-fund" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bridgerton" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjA3L2JyaWRnZXJ0b24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Netflix</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No, it’s not adding more petticoats and Regency-era sex scandals. Netflix is launching a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/netflix-to-spend-100-million-to-help-underrepresented-communities-in-entertainment-11614348003?mod=hp_lista_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">global fund</a> that will direct $100 million to initiatives supporting underrepresented groups in entertainment. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The program expands on the company’s existing efforts to donate tens of millions to groups that support the Black community following racial justice protests last summer.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>A new study by the University of Southern California’s Annenberg Inclusion Initiative found that underrepresented groups accounted for <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/26/business/media/netflix-diversity-movies-original-series.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">36% of Netflix film leads</a> in 2018 and 2019. That’s 8% more leads and co-leads from underrepresented groups than were in the top 100 grossing films for the same years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Behind the small screen, the study says Netflix has industry-standard levels of minority writers and directors, and the company’s <a href="https://about.netflix.com/en/news/netflix-inclusion-report-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first-ever inclusion report</a> revealed that 46% of its US employees come from underrepresented communities. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Another finding: </strong>More than half of the leads and co-leads in Netflix’s films and shows are women, meaning the streamer has hit gender parity for those roles. It’s also ahead of its peers in hiring female creators and writers. <strong style="color:#000">   </strong></p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY MUGSY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<a href="https://mugsyjeans.com/collections/comfortable-mens-jeans?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=2_27&utm_content=field" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Mugsy" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjM3MC8xNjE0Mjk3ODY3LUlNR18zNjAyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">COMFY PANTS EDITION. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Can you <strong style="color:#000">spot the lie</strong> about <a href="https://mugsyjeans.com/collections/comfortable-mens-jeans?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=2_27&utm_content=field" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mugsy Jeans</a>? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. They look like jeans but feel like sweatpants</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. You could sleep in them (heck, we might recommend it)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. MLB players petitioned the league to adopt them as part of their official uniform</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. They’re made of proprietary denim that’s stretchy and flexible </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know you’re likely scratching your head right now, thinking about how uncomfortable your regular jeans feel in all the places they shouldn’t—or how you’ve just been called out for not wearing real pants since last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So, we’ll give you a clue to the game. Mugsy makes <em>the</em> most comfortable jeans for men. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://mugsyjeans.com/collections/comfortable-mens-jeans?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=2_27&utm_content=field" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Now get into the comfy pants game with a pair of Mugsy Jeans</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">[Quiz Answer: The MLB thing, but never say never.]</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/26/key-performance-indicators-february-27?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We continue to believe that ABNB remains the best asset in travel.”—Jeffries was one of several firms that wrote <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/26/airbnb-soars-after-earnings-as-one-analyst-calls-it-the-best-asset-in-travel.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bullish notes</a> about Airbnb a day after the company topped revenue expectations for Q4. The stock popped more than 13%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The number of homes for sale in the US has <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/26/upshot/where-have-all-the-houses-gone.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fallen by about half</a> compared to last winter, per Altos Research. We are in a serious inventory crunch, folks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>A profile of Janelle Jones, the first Black woman to be chief Labor economist. (<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-26/biden-economist-janelle-jones-has-her-eye-on-an-equal-recovery?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg</a>)</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
VIDEO GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/26/pokmon-keeps-evolving-turns-25?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pokémon Turns 25
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Pokemon birthday" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=451 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/EktbegF3J8QIo/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Pokemon birthday" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/EktbegF3J8QIo/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Feel old yet? A quarter-century ago today, the Red and Green versions of Pokémon for Game Boy were released in Japan, sending a spark through pop culture that didn’t go out when you stopped playing <em>Pokémon GO</em>... </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">2020 was Pokémon’s second-most profitable year, ever</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Pokémon Company earned $143 million in net profit last year, <a href="https://gamerant.com/pokemon-company-earnings-2020/#:~:text=According%20to%20the%20Gamebiz%20figures,a%2014.8%25%20increase%20from%202019.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">14.8% more</a> than in 2019. How has the franchise avoided becoming a fad?</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Everyone can play. </strong></span><span>Engadget calls the video games “</span><span><a href="https://www.engadget.com/pokemon-25th-anniversary-143049469.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">baby’s first RPG</a></span><span>” (role-playing game) for a reason. They’re kid-friendly, but they have advanced options for adults, too.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">It’s always evolving</strong></span><span>. For instance, 2020 was the augmented reality app </span><span><em>Pokémon GO</em></span><span>’s top-grossing year—not 2016 when it debuted—thanks in part to a </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/04/pokmon-go-made-record-1-billion-year?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new slate</a></span><span> of stay-at-home-friendly features, reports Sensor Tower.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Pikachu is cuter than Baby Yoda. </strong></span><span>With nearly 1,000 Pokémon to catch, there’s a creature everyone can identify with, and all of them are highly marketable (well, </span><span><a href="https://kotaku.com/a-poll-for-the-ugliest-pokemon-1775488760?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">maybe not Grimer</a></span><span>).</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>in the short-term, you can watch a <a href="https://25.pokemon.com/en-us/music/p25music-concert?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pokémon x Post Malone concert</a> at 7pm ET and in the medium-term, see how Pokémon’s evolving again into an <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/2/26/22302841/pokemon-legends-arceus-open-world-rpg-nintendo-switch?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">open-world RPG</a>.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFayez Nureldine/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe US has concluded that Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/26/us-intelligence-concludes-saudi-crown-prince-mohammed-bin-salman-approved-killing-of-journalist-jamal-khashoggi-.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproved\u003c/a\u003e an operation to “capture or kill” journalist Jamal Khashoggi, according to an intelligence report released yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe backstory\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKhashoggi, a Washington Post columnist and critic of the Saudi royal family, was assassinated in 2018 in the Saudi consulate in Istanbul. Khashoggi’s killing drew outrage from the international media and US lawmakers, and investigations zeroed in on the role of Mohammed bin Salman (MBS), the 35-year-old de facto ruler of the kingdom. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the report released yesterday, we learned the CIA’s reasoning for implicating MBS: He’s so powerful and controls so much of the Saudi intelligence apparatus that there’s simply no way this operation would’ve happened without him giving the thumbs up. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy it matters for the business world\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs the world’s largest oil exporter, Saudi Arabia has always been influential in the global energy market. But its recent push to diversify away from fossil fuels means it’s become a muscular player in defense, high tech, and even entertainment.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe kingdom’s sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund of Saudi Arabia (PIF), has \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cbinsights.com/research/saudi-arabia-pif-tech-investments/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvested\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in more tech companies than the average college sophomore on Robinhood. It acquired a large stake in Uber, and it’s also funded Tesla, Virgin Galactic, and Lucid Motors. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSaudi Arabia is also the largest buyer of US defense goods.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFollowing Khashoggi’s murder in 2018, corporate America tried to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2018-10-16/skipping-davos-in-the-desert-in-khashoggi-s-name-isn-t-enough?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edistance itself\u003c/a\u003e from the kingdom by skipping the buzzy “Davos in the Desert” investment conference held in the Saudi capital, Riyadh. But many returned the next year as pressure died down, partially because President Trump tried to squash any tensions that would interfere with the US-Saudi relationship. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewhile Biden is aiming to “recalibrate” the US’ stance toward Saudi Arabia, he’s still tiptoeing around. According to the NYT, the president \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/26/us/politics/biden-mbs-khashoggi.html?action=click\u0026module=Spotlight\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eisn’t planning\u003c/a\u003e on directly penalizing MBS for his role in Khashoggi’s murder because the price of alienating a geopolitical ally is “too high.”  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn the US...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e70.5 million doses, or 21.2 doses for every 100 people, have been administered, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. That’s up from 59.1 million doses last Saturday.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAround the world…\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e231 million doses have been administered in 100 different countries, up from 193 million doses in 87 countries last week.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe latest updates\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn the launching pad: \u003c/strong\u003eJohnson \u0026 Johnson’s single-dose vaccine candidate is on the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/johnson-and-johnson-covid-19-vaccine-fda-expert-panel-recommendation-11614294002?page=1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003everge of approval\u003c/a\u003e after a panel of health experts recommended it for authorization yesterday. The FDA is expected to greenlight what would be the US’ third approved vaccine sometime later today. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShould’ve stayed home: \u003c/strong\u003eThe head of Canada’s largest pension fund \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/canada-pension-fund-head-resigns-after-report-of-covid-19-vaccination-in-middle-east-11614347392?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eresigned yesterday\u003c/a\u003e over a trip he took to get a vaccine shot in the UAE. The trip wasn’t illegal, but it \u003cem\u003ewas\u003c/em\u003e a bad look given Canada’s slooooow vaccine rollout—as of Thursday, only 4.5% of its population had received at least one dose. Speaking of...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCleared for takeoff:\u003c/strong\u003e Regulators in Canada \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/international/americas/540701-canada-approves-astrazeneca-covid-19-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproved AstraZeneca’s vaccine\u003c/a\u003e for adults, the third vaccine it’s approved.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL \u003cem\u003eBridgerton\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca alt=\"Bridgerton\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjA3L2JyaWRnZXJ0b24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNetflix\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNo, it’s not adding more petticoats and Regency-era sex scandals. Netflix is launching a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/netflix-to-spend-100-million-to-help-underrepresented-communities-in-entertainment-11614348003?mod=hp_lista_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eglobal fund\u003c/a\u003e that will direct $100 million to initiatives supporting underrepresented groups in entertainment. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe program expands on the company’s existing efforts to donate tens of millions to groups that support the Black community following racial justice protests last summer.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eA new study by the University of Southern California’s Annenberg Inclusion Initiative found that underrepresented groups accounted for \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/26/business/media/netflix-diversity-movies-original-series.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e36% of Netflix film leads\u003c/a\u003e in 2018 and 2019. That’s 8% more leads and co-leads from underrepresented groups than were in the top 100 grossing films for the same years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBehind the small screen, the study says Netflix has industry-standard levels of minority writers and directors, and the company’s \u003ca href=\"https://about.netflix.com/en/news/netflix-inclusion-report-2021?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst-ever inclusion report\u003c/a\u003e revealed that 46% of its US employees come from underrepresented communities. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnother finding: \u003c/strong\u003eMore than half of the leads and co-leads in Netflix’s films and shows are women, meaning the streamer has hit gender parity for those roles. It’s also ahead of its peers in hiring female creators and writers. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e   \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFeel old yet? A quarter-century ago today, the Red and Green versions of Pokémon for Game Boy were released in Japan, sending a spark through pop culture that didn’t go out when you stopped playing \u003cem\u003ePokémon GO\u003c/em\u003e... \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e2020 was Pokémon’s second-most profitable year, ever\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Pokémon Company earned $143 million in net profit last year, \u003ca href=\"https://gamerant.com/pokemon-company-earnings-2020/#:~:text=According%20to%20the%20Gamebiz%20figures,a%2014.8%25%20increase%20from%202019.?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e14.8% more\u003c/a\u003e than in 2019. How has the franchise avoided becoming a fad?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEveryone can play. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEngadget calls the video games “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/pokemon-25th-anniversary-143049469.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebaby’s first RPG\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” (role-playing game) for a reason. They’re kid-friendly, but they have advanced options for adults, too.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s always evolving\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. For instance, 2020 was the augmented reality app \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ePokémon GO\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e’s top-grossing year—not 2016 when it debuted—thanks in part to a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/04/pokmon-go-made-record-1-billion-year?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew slate\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of stay-at-home-friendly features, reports Sensor Tower.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePikachu is cuter than Baby Yoda.
